name: Projects Module Training
title: Projects Module Training
body:
Overview

This will be, by far, the area of the product where you will be spending most of your time, so it is crucial that you get properly acquainted with this main area.

You can always go ahead and read through the Projects topic article, however, it is best that you take "assisted training" with hands-on, given the product complexity.

Now that you're fully setup to tackle this, go ahead and open the Tutorials article on your other screen, and do side by side hands-on with the video tutorials (create a folder, create a survey, setup questions etc.). 

Deliverables

  • When creating your surveys, make sure you leverage every question type (links below from Question types for easy access/reference if you want to dive into them right away). It is up to you to decide 
    • Text and multimedia
    • Single response
    • Multiple response list
    • Fields for text input
    • Matrix questions
    • Sliders
    • Ranking - Rating
    • Advanced
  • At the end of this activity, you are expected to have at least 2 surveys/projects created: at least an Anonymous one and a Personalized survey, where you have mixed the question types.

Additional notes for the hands-on activity

  • You need to create your own folder, so when creating your folder, use this specific format: Central_training <your_name>
  • Put folder below the Default folder
  • When creating projects/surveys:

    • Any surveys that you create (as part of this tutorial/walkthrough/training) need to be placed in your own folder.
    • It is best that you select English language
    • As Accounting Org, select Dummy Customer
    • Make sure the project is shared with the System Administrator team
  • Note that the tutorials are based on the old UI of DXI/EFS, so don't panic! There has been a visual overhaul, but the functions should be organized in the same manner.
  • You will likely also see some special options missing, for example ones prepended with qb only tag; those functions are reserved for the root user only (which is a godlike admin), so you can ignore those for now.
  • Throughout the software, you can also hover over the i icon for information about each option.

Helper articles

Doing side-by-side exploration as indicated above should provide enough to get you familiar with the end-to-end Projects experience. The below articles may also come in handy, but it would be recommended to refer to them only if you have something unclear from the tutorials, as they are pretty long-winded.

  • How-to: My First Survey
  • How-to: Survey Distribution – Anonymous and Personalized Survey
  • How-to: Monitoring the Progress of my Survey

Additional sub-topics

The below sub-topics are not covered in the video tutorials, and they represent other important core functionalities of the product, which you will most likely often encounter in your day-to-day DXI activities. 

GDPR

How-to: Privacy Assistant (GDPR)

Given the nature of the software, privacy is an extremely important aspect, especially as a lot of our customers are from EU. The Privacy Assistant in Tivian's Enterprise Feedback Suite (EFS) is a feature designed to help users comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) when conducting surveys.

Remember, once you activate the Privacy Assistant and set your project to "Active," the status cannot be reversed.

The Language Editor

Language editor

Well, it is pretty obvious what this does: it helps with setting up multilingual surveys. Do note that there is no localization or automated translation available, so if any customer wants multilingual surveys, they would have to set up each item individual for each language.

Triggers

Triggers Topic Article

Triggers in EFS are automated actions that occur when specific conditions or events happen during a survey. They are designed to streamline processes and enhance the functionality of your surveys. For example, a mail trigger can be set up to send an email when a participant completes a certain page or meets a condition you've specified. This could be used to send a thank you message, a follow-up survey, or any other communication automatically.

Plausichecks (plausibility checks)

How do I set up plausibility checks in questionnaires?

These checks basically make sure that the questionnaire is properly filled in by the participant. Think of these as the required fields that you see everywhere in online forms, so they are used to make sure that participants fill in the required data and also that it is the expected format (for example, that an email field has a valid email address or that a numeric value falls within the proper range)
